normalised: **five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide 5G rollout is progressing steadily, according to a recent report from the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). Major telecom operators, including Airtel and Jio, are expanding their 5G networks to tier-II and tier-III cities after initial launches in metropolitan areas like Mumbai and Delhi on 01/10/2022.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide five G rollout is progressing steadily, according to a recent report from the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I). Major telecom operators, including Airtel and Jio, are expanding their five G networks to tier-two and tier-three cities after initial launches in metropolitan areas like Mumbai and Delhi on first october two thousand and twenty two.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) projects that over 80% of the country will have 5G coverage by the end of 2024. This expansion is expected to boost economic growth and facilitate digital inclusion, particularly in rural areas often underserved by existing 4G infrastructure.
normalised: The Department of Telecommunications (D o T) projects that over eighty percent of the country will have five G coverage by the end of two thousand and twenty four. This expansion is expected to boost economic growth and facilitate digital inclusion, particularly in rural areas often underserved by existing four G infrastructure.

unnormalised: Jio announced today, 17/07/2024, plans to invest an additional Rs. 40,000 crore in expanding its 5G network, focusing on deploying indigenous technology developed in collaboration with IIT Madras. Early data from users in Lucknow at 14:00 hrs indicates an average download speed of 500 Mbps. Analysts predict that 5G will unlock new opportunities in sectors such as agriculture, healthcare, and education, aligning with the government's "Digital India" initiative. The complete rollout, if all goes to plan, should be effective before Diwali.
normalised: Jio announced today, seventeenth july two thousand and twenty four, plans to invest an additional rupee forty billion in expanding its five G network, focusing on deploying indigenous technology developed in collaboration with I I T Madras. Early data from users in Lucknow at two P M indicates an average download speed of five hundred megabits per second. Analysts predict that five G will unlock new opportunities in sectors such as agriculture, healthcare, and education, aligning with the government's "Digital India" initiative. The complete rollout, if all goes to plan, should be effective before Diwali.
